item.title: Star Wars Modders Have Taken Battlefront 3 Into Their Own Hands And It Looks Great
item.content:encoded:
After four years of development, the launch of an open beta for KYBER, a community-hosted, multiplayer game launcher for EA‚Äôs Star Wars Battlefront II, is proving to be a hit with the same fans who desperately campaigned for EA to start making Star Wars Battlefront III last year.

In June 2025, EA‚Äôs Star Wars Battlefront II received an unprecedented uptick in players on Steam. Having previously peaked at an all-time player count of 10,489 in January 2021, Star Wars Battlefront II more than tripled this figure with an all-time peak of 35,892, thanks in part to a bargain bin sale price of $5 at the time.

The sudden surge in player count was attributed to a fan campaign on Reddit by members of the r/StarWarsBattlefront community, following the success of Andor‚Äôs second season. The community‚Äôs goal was simple; they wanted to convince EA and Disney that a potential Star Wars Battlefront III sequel would be a success.

At KYBER, we like pineapple on our pizzaüççüçï

In other news, Star Wars Battlefront 2 got its first content update of 2026 on PC, and you can play it right now!

Go to the website in our bio to play KYBER for free üéÆ https://t.co/csAqDU6e2t pic.twitter.com/Cb4AErk3D1

‚Äî KYBER: Battlefront II Custom Servers (@KyberServers) January 13, 2026

The community‚Äôs plea seemingly went ignored, as neither EA nor Star Wars rights holders Disney have expressed any intention to develop a new multiplayer shooter. Obviously, it was never going to be that simple, but the attention did seemingly galvanise Armchair Developers, the team behind KYBER: Battlefront II, into action. 

Although KYBER had already been in development for several years before this point, the project‚Äôs community manager, Ethan Clark, revealed that the team ‚Äúworked nonstop all week, doing our best to help the content and mod creation communities fire on all cylinders‚Äù following the success of the May 24th ‚ÄúResurgence Day‚Äù Star Wars Battlefront II campaign.

Battlefront 2 with more guns and classes

KYBER is an ‚Äúall-in-one launcher‚Äù for Star Wars Battlefront II that adds a wealth of player-requested features to the game, including proximity voice chat, a spectator mode, and even fully-integrated Discord support. Of course, the real draw here is the newly added characters and the expanded mod support, including the likes of Star Wars Jedi: Survivor‚Äôs Cal Kestis and Star Wars: The Clone Wars‚Äô Asajj Ventress.

The open beta for KYBER started on December 20, and, according to a post from the official KyberServers team account, resulted in ‚Äú61,169 unique players‚Äù and ‚Äú1,339,489 sessions‚Äù within the first 48 hours of its release. Unsurprisingly, the r/StarWarsBattlefield community also seems thrilled with how the player test has been going. A one user on the subreddit explained, it‚Äôs like Battlefront 2 but with more classes, guns, some balance changes too.‚Äù

The open beta doesn‚Äôt seem to have a hard end date yet, and Armchair Developers announced that they have big plans for the project down the line. They‚Äôve promised that the source code for KYBER ‚Äúwill be made available to the public‚Äù later this month, and that further balance patches are already in the works. It‚Äôs not quite Star Wars Battlefront III yet, but with a couple of extra characters and a few more new maps, it certainly could be. Hopefully, someone at EA or Disney is paying attention.



https://kotaku.com/star-wars-battlefront-3-swbf2-mod-kyber-2000659850
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: The 10-Year Wait For ‚ÄòMinecraft Killer‚Äô Hytale Is Finally Over
item.content:encoded:
I‚Äôm currently exploring, crafting and building my way through Minecraft-like Hytale to find out what this long-delayed blocky survival sim does to differentiate itself from its obvious inspiration. But in the meantime, let‚Äôs take a look at what‚Äôs already happened in the game‚Äôs first 24 hours since releasing into early access.

Hytale very nearly didn‚Äôt happen. The cuboid sandbox game has been in production since 2015 from Hypixel Studios, with financial support from Riot Games for the first few years until the massive company bought Hypixel outright in 2020. However, big twist: in June 2025 Riot cancelled the whole project, leaving its future in serious doubt. But then another twist: in November of last year, the game‚Äôs original founder Simon Collins-Laflamme bought the entire IP back from Riot and revived development. Just two months later the game is out in early access, making Riot‚Äôs decision all the more peculiar.

It‚Äôs not nearly finished, it‚Äôs fair to say. If you buy the game now you‚Äôll find its central hub area is mostly various buildings with ‚ÄúUnder Construction‚Äù signs on them, and the game‚Äôs ‚ÄúAdventure‚Äù mode is yet to be added alongside Survival and Creative. However, you‚Äôll also find a very familiar style of game if you‚Äôve ever played Minecraft, but with much higher-fidelity graphics, a far more complex array of crafting tables, and the slightest touch of creature collecting. So how‚Äôs it going so far?

Well, pretty well! In the first 24 hours Hytale became the most watched game on Twitch, with 420,000 viewers across many, many streams. And perhaps more significantly, Collins-Laflamme took to X just before launch to say pre-orders have been so successful that the game has already secured a further two years of development costs.

Pleased to announce that we have officially secured the next two years of development costs through pre-purchases. Combined with my personal commitment of ten years, we are looking very strong for the future ‚ù§Ô∏è

Thank you all for the support.

Hytale is saved.
We are almost home.

‚Äî Simon (@Simon_Hypixel) January 12, 2026

Yay Patch Notes!

The game has already received its first hotfix, aimed at fixing crashes caused by eyebrows, squelching a bug that stopped Norwegian people from launching it, and preventing buckets from breaking the game. Of course, this being early access, Hypixel are keen to communicate that the game is still going to be packed with issues and bugs. In a blog post celebrating the pre-release of the game, the team asks people to keep in mind the following:

  • Early Access ‚Äì many features are still missing, and bugs are expected
  • It‚Äôs only been two months since we reacquired Hytale ‚Äì and that‚Äôs how long we‚Äôve had to prepare the game and rebuild the team from the ground up
  • Demand has exceeded our expectations, which means launch week will be bumpy, but we‚Äôll get everyone in

The game, which is currently only available for PC but plans to make its way to PS5 and Xbox, does already allow modding and as such, people are already getting creative. Perhaps the most stand-out example would be someone getting Doom running in the game before it even released. As PC Gamer spotted, it‚Äôs achieved by importing a Java version of id‚Äôs shooter, then having it rendered via color-changing blocks within Hytale. Or witchcraft.

Exploration Motivation

The Exploration mode is the ‚Äúproper‚Äù way to play the game just now, where the procedurally generated collection of biomes contains really elaborate structures to discover, and also all the core ingredients for the Minecraft survivalist. So you can build homes (I‚Äôve made a lovely log cabin!), grow crops, craft ever-more useful tools, and do all this solo or with chums. Digging down proves similarly elaborate, with big underground structures to explore, and of course mobs to battle. There are also the vestigial beginnings of the game‚Äôs story, with a hub area you can teleport to once you find the Forgotten Temple, speak to a couple of NPCs, and begin a task to identify as many species of creatures as you can in order to unlock new crafts.

The forthcoming Adventure mode appears to promise a lot more RPG-like elements that will hopefully better distinguish the game from its inspirations, but in the meantime the focus is really on venturing far from where you spawn and discovering its much more detailed landscapes and the mobs within.



https://kotaku.com/hytale-minecraft-riot-hotfix-doom-early-access-2000659825
item.dc:creator: invalid@example.com (ResetEra_Newsbot

item.title: This Asus TUF Gaming Desktop PC (Nvidia GPU, 512GB SSD) Is So Cheap You‚Äôll Want to Buy It Instantly
item.content:encoded:
Yes, you can game on most standard PCs out there, but these options aren‚Äôt designed to provide you with an immersive gaming experience that brings your favorite titles to life. If you‚Äôre looking to play better in 2026, a dedicated gaming PC is a must-have.

Like all nice things, the best gaming PCs on the market can cost a pretty penny, but that‚Äôs not the case today. Amazon just dropped the 2025 ASUS TUF T500 PC by 11% which brings its $900 price to $800 ‚Äì an impressive $100 discount. There are no complicated coupon codes to enter or long checkout steps to worry about, either. Just add the PC to your cart, and the discount applies automatically.

See offer

Premium Look, Incredible Performance

The PC flaunts a stunning, mecha-inspired design with bold lines, yellow accents, and a transparent side panel. It gives off a rugged, anime-inspired look that‚Äôs instantly going to catch the attention of anyone and is sure to turn heads. The clear side panel offers a stunning view of your rig with RGB lighting. The lights are customizable, so you can choose the color you want. Maybe go for yellow for a premium feel, or something a bit more vibrant if you want your PC to make a statement.

It runs on an Intel Core i5-13420H CPU that offers a great balance of performance and price. Paired with the NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3050 GPU, it can run most modern games smoothly, and even lets you work on resource-intensive creative projects with ease. There‚Äôs a modest 16GB RAM that keeps things snappy as you push through tasks. We‚Äôre talking casual gaming with friends while streaming, and juggling demanding tasks like video editing and 3D design without slowing down.

The 512GB PCIe Gen 4 SSD storage makes it easy to keep all your favorite gaming titles, plus other media content and projects close, in a single place. SSDs are also known to be much faster than their traditional counterparts in terms of performance. What does this mean for you? Speedy file transfers and much quicker application launches throughout the day. Despite all this performance, the PC stays cool as it works. That‚Äôs thanks to its custom copper heatpipes and a 90mm fan, both of which come together to offer optimized airflow. This keeps the temperatures in check and also prevents noisy operation, even when things get a bit intense.

Exceptional durability comes from the PC‚Äôs MIL-STD-810H certification against shock, vibration, heat, and altitude. Basically, it‚Äôs going to support your gaming adventures and creative projects for years to come. Speaking of long-term use, you‚Äôll also appreciate the tool-less side panels and the spacious interior, which make it easy to upgrade and maintain your system over time. It‚Äôs built to grow with you as your needs change.

To wrap it up, if you‚Äôve been on the lookout for a reliable, muscular gaming PC that can handle pressure well, the ASUS TUF T500 is an excellent option to consider. It‚Äôs now down to $800, after Amazon generously took $100 off its usual price. We highly recommend grabbing it as soon as you can, as the price can shoot back up at any moment now.

See offer



https://kotaku.com/this-asus-tuf-gaming-desktop-pc-nvidia-gpu-512gb-ssd-is-so-cheap-youll-want-to-buy-it-instantly-2000659757

item.title: The Coolest Thing About Deadpool In Marvel Rivals Isn‚Äôt The Role Swapping
item.content:encoded:
Deadpool is coming to Marvel Rivals, and it‚Äôs fitting that the Merc with a Mouth would pretty much break every rule the hero shooter has established in its first year. He‚Äôs a flex character that is capable of swapping between the tank, damage, and support roles throughout a match, and he already looks like a pretty busted version of all three based on the first gameplay trailer. But one of the cool, less-talked-about aspects of Deadpool‚Äôs kit is how it implements his status as a fourth-wall-breaking troublemaker into his ability set.

With all of his erratic movements and all the comic-book-style frames and other details that frequently pop up around him, Deadpool‚Äôs moveset is one of the harder ones to read in the Marvel Rivals roster. I‚Äôm sure once we actually get to play as the character, we‚Äôll all get more familiar with his arsenal of tools and develop a sense of what he‚Äôs capable of. But for now, one of the things that stands out to me is how NetEase implemented the meta element of the character into how he fights. 

Throughout a match, Deadpool will level up with buffs depending on his role, and you access these by opening up a Marvel Rivals comic book that Deadpool will flip through as you choose your upgrades. He also has abilities that break the fourth wall, such as one that shows a mini streamer portrait of the hero on an opponent‚Äôs screen that smacks them around with a hammer. Not sure how you avoid that or if it‚Äôs a sort of ‚Äústatus effect‚Äù with a set duration, but it‚Äôs appropriately obnoxious for Wade Wilson‚Äôs kit to have comic-book pop-ups and winks to the camera.

Deadpool is joining the Marvel Rivals roster in season 6, which begins on January 16.



https://kotaku.com/deadpool-marvel-rivals-role-fourth-wall-break-meta-2000659834
